segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for a person who talks a lot.

segments.pli: Musā bhaṇati, pisuṇaṃ bhaṇati, pharusaṃ bhaṇati, samphappalāpaṃ bhaṇati, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, and nonsensical. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ādīnavā bahubhāṇismiṃ puggale.
segments.en: These are the five drawbacks for a person who talks a lot.
There are these five benefits for a person who talks thoughtfully.

segments.pli: Na musā bhaṇati, na pisuṇaṃ bhaṇati, na pharusaṃ bhaṇati, na samphappalāpaṃ bhaṇati, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: They don’t use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, and nonsensical. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā mantabhāṇismiṃ puggale”ti.
segments.en: These are the five benefits for a person who talks thoughtfully.”
